result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernesto Fuentes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: As to Count 1: pay a fine of $5000 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probably cause.
Do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances.
Must provide a DNA specimen for testing and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Commencing by noon on 5-29-14-concurrent with work release for work, dialysis and any requires transplant--no good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernesto Fuentes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ernesto Fuentes not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

Defendant Ernesto Fuentes in court with attorney Steven R Kohn.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 12 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 8 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4 years.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 6 years - concurrent with Count 1; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4 years - concurrent with Count 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; 3) as to Count 1: pay a fine of $5,000 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 4) As to Count 2: pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 5) SERVE 10 MONTHS at the House of Correction commencing by noon on 5-29-14 -concurrent - with work release for work, dialysis and any required transplant - no good time. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharge - if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
on behalf of defendant, filed. cmt

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to amended Count 1 and Count 2 as charged and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as amended and Count 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.

Defendant Ernesto Fuentes in court with attorney Steven R Kohn.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court orders the penalty enhancer of "Use of a Dangerous Weapon" in Count 1 DISMISSED. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ernesto Fuentes in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription,  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (3/19/14). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference in Branch 44.vb

Defendant Ernesto Fuentes in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
